description: Knowledge and news about Cardano are mostly in English,it is difficult to reach Japanese community, affecting the expansion of Cardano...

description: Cardano and blockchain in general are complicated concepts to comprehend for regular people. Same is true here in East Asia.

title: Future of Cardano is in East Asia
description: Youth across various East Asian countries are unaware of Cardano and the entrepreneurship opportunities that exist.

title: Cardano Malaysia Community
description: Malaysia doesn’t have a community that actively engages in Blockchain and Cardano.

author: dimitri777
title: Cardano in Khmer (Cambodian)
description: Lack of official Khmer content . Khmer speakers cant learn in their language.  2.3 million native speakers  In Cambodia and Internationally

author: dimitri777
title: Cardano in Laotian
description: Lack of official Laotian content . Laotian speakers cant learn in their language.  30 million native speakers  In Laos  and Internationally

author: carlhenryglobal
title: Sustainable forestry Hub Cambodia
description: We need to build sustainable Cardano Community Hubs around viable local projects, deforestation is a worldwide problem.

author: lucasmac9
title: Bringing E.A Investors to Cardano
description: It's hard for people outside crypto to enter into this industry. The Space is saturated with Misleading projects and high risk investments.

title: Networking/promotional events Japan
description: Cardano has only had approval to be listed in Japan for 7 months. We need more excitement generated for ADA now more than ever in the region

title: Onboarding Manual for Dummies

author: sabrinaliu47
title: Cardano Community Hubs in Taiwan

author: dimitri777
title: Cardano in Burmese

author: dimitri777
title: Cardano in Thai
description: Lack of official Thai content . Thus Thai speakers cannot learn in their native language. There are 80 million speakers globally.

author: revelar
title: Duo - Filipino Gameplay
description: NFT based play-to-earn games often focus on natively English-speaking cultures, which diminishes the possibility of a rich global community.
